Posts.Content: congrats on finishing your treatment. I to had allot of the pins and needles symptoms, but it went away in time. Also after a while it started to itch, after 4 years it still happens occationally. As for lumps and bumps I did not have that side affect. Would like to wish you well on your journey to a complete recovery.     tata 99
Posts.Title: radiation side effects

Posts.Content: Doe's anybody have anything positive to say about aromasin. My onc. wants me to change my Tamoxefin for Aromasin, but from what I have read so far there seems to be allot of joint pain associated with that pill. Is there anyone out there taking this pill with minimal side affect?
Posts.Title: positive feedback on aromasin

Posts.Content: Thank you kittycath for your reply to my concerns about the aromasin pills. Have not heard from anyone who have not had any side affect with this pill. It all seems to be allot of joint pain. I keep looking at the box of pills and find excuses why I can't start them right now. My cancer also was caught early. I had 3 months of chemo and 25 treatment of radiation. Hope you have lots of fun at your pink party on the 23rd. Congrats to you and again thank you.
Posts.Title: positive feedback on aromasin

Posts.Content: Thank you kcmarrio for your experience on aromasin. People tell me that taking glucosamine helps with the pain. I haven't started my pills yet, waiting till September to start. I also heard that hot flashes are bad with this pill. I take Dixarit for hot flashes with Tamoxifen, I hope they work with aramasin. Good luck on your recovery to good health.                                                                        Tata99
Posts.Title: positive feedback on aromasin

Posts.Content: hi simona, in response to your question I did not start my Aromasin yet. The feed back was to negative. I plan to stay on Tamoxifen another 2 years and readdress the switch then. I have not seen my oncologist yet dont know what he will have to say about that. I see him in January. Maybe you could let me know how it goes for you in 3 months.  Also for your hot flashes there is a prescription  you can get for that, they work for me, they are called APO-CLONIDINE 0.025MG. Take2 tablets twice daily. Hope this will help you with hotflashes. Good luck to you, hope all goes well with your journey to a full recovery. On 11/3/2008 simona wrote: Thanks for starting this thread!  I've been looking for positive stories myself, as I prepared to switch from Tamoxifen (3 yrs) to Aromasin (for the next 2 yrs).  I remember before I started Tamoxifen reading all sorts of horror stories and never finding any good reports, but other than hot flashes I tolerated it very well.  I'm hoping it's the same story with Aromasin, which I began today. I read you planned on starting Aromasin in Sept.  How are things going for you?
Posts.Title: positive feedback on aromasin

Posts.Content: Thand you Teresa Marie, for your input on this subject. I will try the Glucosamine Chondroitin, also nice to know the damage Aromasin causes can be reversed after you stop them.                                                               Take care Tata
Posts.Title: positive feedback on aromasin

Posts.Content: Thank you bwicksail, for your input on this matter. I intend on taking glucosamine, as well exercise allot more. Good luck to you on your journey, to good health. Tata99

Posts.Content: On 1/28/2009 paulla wrote: i have lump in my breast ,concerned about it going for mammogram and ultra sound and do have pain and throbing.  does anyone out there who had same symtoms as myself and whats your prognosis . good or bad want to know the results from anyone. hope to hear from someone out there    thank you Hi just wanted to let you know how easy it is to get a response. This should appear in you email input box tata talk to you later.
